comment: THE BEST EVER! Best prof ive ever had. Works with you if she sees that you are trying. Cares and wants all her students to get A.

It seems TCOM typically has a rigid course schedule regardless of the professor, so typically anything annoying in the class was out of Dr. Hankey's reach. She does her best with the class, and wants all her students to succeed. Grading was clear & she was very accessible.
Dr Hankey is a QUEEEEEEEEEEEN! I love her! Such an easy grader.

The assignments in the class are not hard and can be fun. No test and the textbook is free and she gives it to you. There is a BIG group project. Unfortunately for me, my teammates were lacking but that's not the fault of the professor. However, the online class seemed very disorganized at times and she can often be slow to respond.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Gives good feedback

comment: Expensive $80-90 textbook, easy class. She's super sweet, caring, and answers questions fast. Assignment due every week, instructions in textbook. One little group project, quizzes pretty often but she drops lowest grades

Dr. Hankey is such a sweet and knowledgeable professor. She can seem a bit all over the place but she will answer any questions that you have and will make adjustments if necessary. Most of the grades come from doing assignments and theres a group project at the end. Easy A for sure.

Dr. Hankey is passionate and knowledgeable about what she teaches. She was also very approachable and caring. If you are a TCOM/TCID major, I 100% recommend taking any of her courses. She provides helpful guidance and truly motivates her students. Really enjoyed her instruction this semester!

Dr. Hankey is a great Professor! She's very helpful and caring. She will sit down with you during class with you and help with your assignment. There are a lot of little assignments that are made with Adobe. Textbook required to do assignments. There's not really a lecture, it's mostly doing hands on assignments. I would recommend.

Professor Hankey is one of the kindest most easy going professors Ive had. She grades really kindly, if you do the work and show effort youll get an A. Textbook is key to the class and is pricey but you learn a lot from it. Shes accessible outside of class which is a plus if you have a question.

The kindest professor! i had to drop because I was already receiving credit for the class through an art course I had already taken, but she was my favorite professor! She goes out of her way to make sure her students understand and helps them with anything they need. She gives great advice about graphic design and interactive design!
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Get ready to read--Caring

comment: Very nice! This was her first time teaching a typography class specifically for Interactive designers. It was easy, fun projects. Wanted input from students on projects. Gave project description ahead of time to allow for choices or to switch projects. Had her for two classes and she really got to know your design style but also gave her input.

She's a very nice professor. The only downsides are that you have to do things her way in some assignments and there are a few pop quizzes, but they are easy as long as you study the vocabulary from the book. As long as you do well on all your projects, you will get an A

This was her first time teaching this particular class but I feel she did an amazing job emphasizing the importance of the concepts in the book. I thought the projects she had were spaced out well and relevant to what we were learning. She has amazing respect for her students and is very open to respectful criticism. I certainly recommend her.

Took her for Foundations of Graphics. She is a VERY nice professor. She is very helpful. If you have questions feel free to ask. She has a pretty detailed timeline for the semester. Just do the work and submit it on-time and you will get a good grade! DON'T PURCHASE THE BOOK UNLESS YOU ABSOLUTELY WANT TO!
Easy and directions are simple and easy to follow. Answers any questions, although lectures can be a little boring. Fun class, and would definitely take again.

She's pretty easy, and she is really helpful in class.  She really helps you learn the basic principles of design and many of the programs in the Adobe Creative Suite.  The two downsides are that you do have to deal with her personal design tastes and you have to buy the book just in case she decides to do tests or quizzes which she does at random.

I really enjoyed her class. I learned a lot and realized that graphic design was what I wanted to do with my life even if i don't make a lot of money doing it. She is very helpful and makes learning graphic design very easy. she's a little discombobulated some times but she is a great professor and a very nice lady.

New teacher. Had her for foundation of graphics. She is a nice lady but a bad teacher. She can't show you things in front of the class. She doesn't teach anything, just shows u pointless videos about fonts. She doesn't know how to work the computer. 5 projects throughout the semester, you can redo each one but she just isn't very helpful.
